text: "Above the Rim" is a song co-written and performed by American contemporary R&B; group Bell Biv DeVoe, issued as the official lead single from the group's second studio album Hootie Mack (following promotional single "From the Back"). The song contains a sample of "South Bronx" by Boogie Down Productions and "Blind Alley" by The Emotions.Bell Biv DeVoe - Hootie Mack (CD liner notes) MCA Records, Inc. 0 08811 06822 6 and it peaked at #81 on the Billboard R&B; chart in 1993. ==Chart positions== {|class="wikitable sortable" |- !Chart (1993) !Peak position |- |US Hot R&B; Singles (Billboard) |align=center|81 |} ==References== ==External links== * * Category:1993 songs Category:1993 singles Category:Bell Biv DeVoe songs Category:MCA Records singles Category:Songs written by Ricky Bell (singer) Category:Songs written by Michael Bivins Category:Songs written by Ronnie DeVoe
title: Above the Rim (song)
